channel.title: 639 compiler & .bin Editor
channel.description:
Hey guys, anyone got a 639 Compiler, I didn't have one so tried to make my own; it didn't work.
[CODE]@echo off javac -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar -sourcepath . *.java pause"[/CODE]
and does anyone know how to edit binary files (.bin); On 639 all the shops and the character files are stored as a .bin file and Notepad and MSWord Can't edit them so any help at all would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks.
[EDIT] - Using Eclipse 639 Client.

item.title: 639 compiler & .bin Editor
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Vs_Claws Ags Vs Claws
item.description:
@Ags_Vs_Claws wrote:

yes but how do you edit the .bin character files, theyre all encrypted?

Read full topic

item.title: 639 compiler & .bin Editor
item.dc:creator: @themightydil themightydil
item.description:
@themightydil wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:2, topic:417588”]Brah you need to learn to use eclipse. There are tools that edit the shops and items that are ran in eclipse as java applications.
Also, Eclipse automatically compiles.

Anyway

FOR THE SERVER

@echo off echo Compiling RS2Server... "C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_17/bin/javac.exe" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/org/dementhium/*.java echo Complete pause

FOR THE CLIENT

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" -cp clientlibs.jar; *.java pause

Don’t forget to change the version of JDK to yours.[/quote]

Thanks man - new 639 Coder.

Read full topic

item.title: 639 compiler & .bin Editor
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Brah you need to learn to use eclipse. There are tools that edit the shops and items that are ran in eclipse as java applications.
Also, Eclipse automatically compiles.

Anyway

FOR THE SERVER

@echo off echo Compiling RS2Server... "C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_17/bin/javac.exe" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/org/dementhium/*.java echo Complete pause

FOR THE CLIENT

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" -cp clientlibs.jar; *.java pause

Don’t forget to change the version of JDK to yours.

Read full topic
